Instruction: Combine balsamic vinegar and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until the sugar has dissolved. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Lower the heat and let the glaze simmer until it thickens and coats the back of a spoon, approximately 20 minutes.
Cool the mixture to room temperature before transferring it to an airtight container. Seal the container and refrigerate for later use.

Here are some suggestions for serving the balsamic reduction: Enjoy it with Gorgonzola cheese and green onions, pasta, portobello mushrooms, or grilled beets and carrots. It also pairs well with salmon or pork and makes a tasty dressing for salads with toasted nuts, dried cranberries, or fresh strawberries.
